name: Crème Brûlée
description: Classic French dessert with rich custard and caramelized sugar topping

instructions.instructionText: In a saucepan, heat cream with split vanilla bean until it just starts to simmer. Remove from heat and let it infuse for 15 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and creamy.
Remove vanilla bean from cream, then slowly whisk the warm cream into the egg mixture.
Pour mixture into ramekins and place them in a deep baking dish. Fill the dish with hot water halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until the custards are set but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Chill the custards for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Before serving, sprinkle each custard with sugar and caramelize with a kitchen torch or under the broiler.
